t: Psalm 104
Praise*pn the Lord,*s my soul. Lord*spn my God, you are very great; you*ld are clothed with splendor and majesty.
The*pn Lord*s wraps himself in light as with a garment; he*ld stretches out the heavens like a tent
and*ld lays the beams of his upper chambers on their waters. He*ln makes the clouds his chariot and*ld rides on the wings of the wind.
He*ln makes winds his messengers, flames*ld of fire his servants.
He*pn set the earth on its foundations; it*ld can never be moved.
You*ln covered it with the watery depths as with a garment; the*ld waters stood above the mountains.
But*ln at your rebuke the waters fled, at*ld the sound of your thunder they took to flight;
they*ln flowed over the mountains, they*ld went down into the valleys, to*ld the place you assigned for them.
You*ln set a boundary they cannot cross; never*ld again will they cover the earth.
He*pn makes springs pour water into the ravines; it*ld flows between the mountains.
They*ln give water to all the beasts of the field; the*ld wild donkeys quench their thirst.
The*ln birds of the sky nest by the waters; they*ld sing among the branches.
He*ln waters the mountains from his upper chambers; the*ld land is satisfied by the fruit of his work.
He*ln makes grass grow for the cattle, and*ld plants for people to cultivate— bringing*ld forth food from the earth:
wine*ln that gladdens human hearts, oil*ld to make their faces shine, and*ld bread that sustains their hearts.
The*ln trees of the Lord*s are well watered, the*ld cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
There*ln the birds make their nests; the*ld stork has its home in the junipers.
The*ln high mountains belong to the wild goats; the*ld crags are a refuge for the hyrax.
He*pn made the moon to mark the seasons, and*ld the sun knows when to go down.
You*ln bring darkness, it becomes night, and*ld all the beasts of the forest prowl.
The*ln lions roar for their prey and*ld seek their food from God.
The*ln sun rises, and they steal away; they*ld return and lie down in their dens.
Then*ln people go out to their work, to*ld their labor until evening.
How*pn many are your works, Lord!*s In*ld wisdom you made them all; the*ld earth is full of your creatures.
There*ln is the sea, vast and spacious, teeming*ld with creatures beyond number— living*ld things both large and small.
There*ln the ships go to and fro, and*ld Leviathan, which you formed to frolic there.
All*pn creatures look to you to*ld give them their food at the proper time.
When*ln you give it to them, they*ld gather it up; when*ln you open your hand, they*ld are satisfied with good things.
When*ln you hide your face, they*ld are terrified; when*ln you take away their breath, they*ld die and return to the dust.
When*ln you send your Spirit, they*ld are created, and*ld you renew the face of the ground.
May*pn the glory of the Lord*s endure forever; may*ld the Lord*s rejoice in his works—
he*ln who looks at the earth, and it trembles, who*ld touches the mountains, and they smoke.
I*pn will sing to the Lord*s all my life; I*ld will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
May*ln my meditation be pleasing to him, as*ld I rejoice in the Lord.*s
But*ln may sinners vanish from the earth and*ld the wicked be no more. Praise*pn the Lord,*s my soul. Praise*pn the Lord.*s
